meanings.definition: Lacking intensity of color or luminousness.
meanings.sent1: The sky was the palest blue I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: Her palest dress was a soft shade of pink.
meanings.sent3: The palest flower in the garden seemed to glow in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The palest light in the room barely illuminated the dark corners.
meanings.sent5: The palest snowflake sparkled like a tiny diamond in the sun.

meanings.sent1: She had the palest skin, like porcelain.
meanings.sent2: The palest child in the family always burned easily in the sun.
meanings.sent3: His face turned the palest shade of white when he saw the ghost costume.
meanings.sent4: The palest girl in the group stood out among the tanned beachgoers.
meanings.sent5: The palest moonlight made her complexion even more striking.

meanings.sent1: She began to pale at the sight of blood.
meanings.sent2: His face paled as he realized his mistake.
meanings.sent3: The room seemed to pale in comparison to the vibrant garden outside.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting paled over time.
meanings.sent5: The stars paled in the light of the full moon.
